name: Nasus

sources.import_notes: Generated baseline canonical champion file from From Online dataset.

notes: Ability effects are intentionally minimal placeholders until scripted modeling is added.

passive.name: Soul Eater
passive.description: Innate:  Nasus gains  life steal based on level.

basic_ability_1.name: Siphoning Strike
basic_ability_1.description: Active:  Nasus' next basic attack within a period will gain  bonus range and deal bonus physical damage based on the amount of Siphoning Strike stacks.
basic_ability_1.description_source:
Both Siphoning Strike's base damage and damage from stacks are treated as  basic damage but also trigger spell effects by also being tagged as  spell damage.
The  basic attack is also considered a part of Siphoning Strike and treated as both  basic damage and  spell damage.
Nasus can gain Siphoning Strike stacks by killing any enemy unit, this includes  champions,  minions,  monsters,  wards,  turrets, and  pets.
Jungle plants and  structures that are not turrets (e.g. inhibitors) will not grant stacks.
Siphoning Strike will not generate stacks from secondary units killed by other effects (e.g.  Tiamat).
Siphoning Strike will trigger  Tear of the Goddess' Manaflow.

basic_ability_2.name: Wither
basic_ability_2.description: Active:  Nasus ages the target enemy champion for a few seconds, gradually  slowing and  crippling them over the duration.
basic_ability_2.description_source:
Wither interrupts the target's attack windup when it is first applied. (bug)
If Wither's duration is affected by  Tenacity the effects will apply slower (negative tenacity percentage) or faster (positive tenacity percentage) so the maximum values are still reached when the modified duration ends.
Wither's cripple effectiveness calculates from its slow's base values, thus  slow resist will not interact with the attack speed modifier indirectly.
Both  slow and  cripple from Wither are considered to be a single debuff. (note)
Therefore,  slow immunity will prevent both, even without technical  cripple immunity.
If the target becomes  untargetable,  dies, or is too far away or no longer in  sight during the cast time, this ability will cancel but does not go on  cooldown nor pay its cost (if applicable).

basic_ability_3.name: Spirit Fire
basic_ability_3.description: Active:  Nasus unleashes a spirit fire at the target location that deals magic damage to enemies within.

ultimate.name: Fury of the Sands
ultimate.description: Active:  Nasus empowers himself for some time, gaining bonus size,  health,  armor,  magic resist, and  attack range.
ultimate.description_source: Fury of the Sands' bonus health is not affected by  Grievous Wounds and Nasus retains it once the duration ends.
